SEARCH

Class MediaItem

java.lang.Object
MediaItem
Direct Known Subclasses:
Audiobook, Book, Ebook
abstract class MediaItem extends Object
An abstract class representing a media item in a library system. This class serves as a base class for different types of media items (like books and audiobooks) and provides common attributes and behaviors shared across all media types. Each media item must have an author, title, length (interpreted differently based on media type), year of release, and total number of items in stock. All attributes are validated during construction and are immutable after creation.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Lindokuhle Dubazane, Annah Masombuka, Given Sitole

  • Constructor Details

    • MediaItem

      MediaItem(String author, String title, int length, int yearReleased, int totalItems)
      Constructs a new MediaItem with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      author - the author/creator of the media item
      title - the title of the media item
      length - the length (pages or runtime) of the media item
      yearReleased - the year when the media item was released
      totalItems - the total number of copies available

  • Method Details

    • getAuthor

      public final String getAuthor()
      Returns the author of this media item.
      Returns:
      the author's name

    • getTitle

      public final String getTitle()
      Returns the title of this media item.
      Returns:
      the title

    • getLength

      public final int getLength()
      Returns the length of this media item. For books, this represents the number of pages. For audiobooks, this represents the runtime in minutes.
      Returns:
      the length of the media item

    • getYearReleased

      public final int getYearReleased()
      Returns the year this media item was released.
      Returns:
      the release year

    • getTotalItems

      public final int getTotalItems()
      Returns the total number of copies of this item available.
      Returns:
      the number of copies in stock

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this media item. The format varies depending on whether the item is an Audiobook or not: - For Audiobooks: "Item[Author=author, title=title, runtime=length, year=yearReleased]" - For other items: "Item[Author=author, title=title, pages=length, year=yearReleased]"
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the media item

    • displayDetails

      public void displayDetails()
      Displays details about the media item. This method can be overridden by subclasses to provide specific implementation.
